titleStmt.title: Frank Magarth et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7480

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Govener of Kentucky

Your Petitioners Beg leave to Represent to your excellency that Frank Mcgurley was at the Present December Term 1865 ^Johnson Cir Ct^ convicted of the offence of Grand Larceny & sentenced to Two years Confinement in the Penitentiary Your Petitioners state that at the Time the Money was taken the said GMcgurley had been Drinking for several days that the offence was commitited while he was Drunk & When he got sober he acknowledged the Deed & Gave up the Money at the Time the offence was committed the said Mcgurley was soldier of the 39 Ky vols that he served his country in the army for three years in the hour Trouble your Petitioners further state that said Mcgurley is a Man of weak mind when sober & none when Drinking wherefore your Petitioners Pray your Excellency to Pardon said Mcgurley & release him form the Penalty of the Law & will Ever Pray

W H Childers ^Jury,^
John R Ouxier Jury.
John M Burns
William Dixon
John Witten Jury.
A W Nickell Sherif of Johnson
James Butcher
Ralph Stafford
Daniel ,R, H
